definition: to get a monkey to perform tricks/to put on a monkey show/to make fun of sb/to tease
to play with/to wield/to act (cool etc)/to display (a skill, one's temper etc)

sentences.english: The monk again severe, but is also a monkey.
sentences.chinese: 唐僧再厉害，也不过是个耍猴的。

sentences.english: Both the new paint and new carpet will be finished by next week.
sentences.chinese: 下周新墙漆会耍猴，新地毯也会换好。

definition: variant of 打把勢|打把势[da3 ba3 shi5]
drill (in sword play)/to thrash around/to demonstrate gymnastic skills/to solicit financial help (in an indirect way)/to show off
baby/small child/(arch.) slave among ethnic minorities
wooden club (used to beat clothes in washing)
(of a performer) to put on a show at an outdoor venue (temple fair, marketplace etc)/(fig.) to enhance sb's reputation/to make a name for oneself
to watch a play/to watch passively (i.e. from the sidelines, from the crowd)
to shout abuses in the street
